document.docAuthor: Menzel, Frank, Smith, Jane E. & Chandler, Peter J.
document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 146 (1)
document.masterDocTitle: The sciarid fauna of the British Isles (Diptera: Sciaridae), including descriptions of six new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The sciarid fauna of the British Isles (Diptera: Sciaridae), including descriptions of six new species
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph:
Literature :? Walker (1848) : 105 [as
Sciara brunnipes
and
Sciara annulata
, misidentification];? Walker (1856) : 52 [as
Sciara brunnipes
]; Edwards (1925a) : 538 [in part as
Sciara brunnipes
and
Sciara annulata
, misidentification];? Edwards (1938) : 201 [as
Sciara ( Neosciara ) umbratica
]; Chandler (1978) : 209 [as
Bradysia umbratica
, misidentification]; Skidmore, Limbert & Eversham (1978): 76; Freeman (1983b) : 34; Skidmore (1991) : 149; Laurence (1994) : 118 [in part]; Laurence (1996): 87 [in part]; Laurence & James (1997) : 166;
Chandler et al . (1996)
: 258 [in part]; Menzel (1998): 20; White et al . (2000): 207 [all as
Bradysia brunnipes
]; Heller (2004) : 248 [
brunnipes (Meigen)
as synonym to
pallipes (Fabricius)
].

Ecological notes : common in broad-leaved and carr woodland; wetlands including fens, water meadows and sedge beds; grazed meadow; grassland; gardens; open montane habitats; mushroom beds. Reared from cow and sheep dung. ii–xi.
